posts.post_content:
i liked its other picture, and its swamp cousin, i have 4 of these, after i gave 4 away to a new player,  
  
they weren't bad back in the day when vanilla creatures nearly always cost 1x for a x/x creature,  
and for a while it was a good blue beefy creature  
but it wasn't necessarily good, even back then  
and now it isn't even playable at all. at all!  
  
they need a legendary wizard holding a fish bowel and a bunny that lets you sacrafice it for a 6/6 vizzerdrix token

Posted By: 1qazxsw (11/6/2011 5:17:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Horrible. Consider that this card was made AFTER Mahamoti Djinn, which itself was considered a solid card, but by no means a game-breaker or format-defining. Magic went through a period spanning from about 5th edition to 9th where it was considered acceptable to clutter up the base set with absolutely unplayable garbage like this card. Apparently, it was "good" for new players to pull useless cards from core sets while experienced players pulled far more powerful cards from expansions.
posts.html:
Horrible. Consider that this card was made AFTER Mahamoti Djinn, which itself was considered a solid card, but by no means a game-breaker or format-defining. Magic went through a period spanning from about 5th edition to 9th where it was considered acceptable to clutter up the base set with absolutely unplayable garbage like this card. Apparently, it was "good" for new players to pull useless cards from core sets while experienced players pulled far more powerful cards from expansions.
